thread.title: Chinese Travel Firms in Tie Up as Competition Rises
thread.title_full: Chinese Travel Firms in Tie Up as Competition Rises - WSJ

author: Alyssa Abkowitz
title: Chinese Travel Firms in Tie Up as Competition Rises
text:
BEIJING—Two of China’s biggest online travel companies are joining forces amid intensifying competition for booking train, plane and hotel reservations in the fast-growing market.
U.S.-traded Ctrip.com International Ltd. said on Monday it would take a 45% stake in rival Qunar Cayman Islands Ltd., which is also traded in New York. Chinese Internet search giant Baidu Inc., which backs Qunar, would take about a 25% stake in Ctrip.
